definitions.explanation_en: A proper noun, typically used as a surname of English origin, derived from the given name David, meaning 'beloved'. It is commonly found in English-speaking countries and may refer to notable individuals in various fields.
definitions.explanation_cn: 一个专有名词，通常作为源自英文名 David 的姓氏使用，意为‘被爱的’。常见于英语国家，可指代各领域中的知名人物。
definitions.example_en: Davis was awarded the Nobel Prize in Physics for his groundbreaking research on quantum mechanics.
definitions.example_cn: 戴维斯因在量子力学领域的开创性研究而荣获诺贝尔物理学奖。
